title: Gotta love junglers
body:
Who don't tell the team they don't have smite available, or start dragon/baron while all enemy team is up WITHOUT SMITE AVAILABLE!
or try to steal... without smite available.

and my personal favourite, smiting a cannon minion or scuttle crab then starting baron/dragon..

**honestly fuking stop it you useless plebs.**

replies.body:
Without smite available doesn't mean you don't stand a chance when stealing.

But I do agree that you need to have smite if you plan on doing risky dragon with enemy team all around you.

I agree with you, but they should at least communicate that point to you, so we can save our burst for secure.
more often then not tho, i've found they say nothing at all.  


tbh it wouldn't bother me losing an objective if the jungler didn't have smite, just get the timer and move on  but what pisses me off is when they force a team play, don't communicate, and risk control.

Yer communication is definitely vital.

People need to do that better.

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=KBAWy54Q,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-01-05T05:46:57.654+0000)
>
> Yer communication is definitely vital.
> 
> People need to do that better.

it is soloqueue, communication is almost non-existant in a lot of elos, only once you get into plat might there be any real communication, but communication isn't really needed, to be required to communicate means your team lacks common sense.

Like say in bronze, 2 minion waves are heading to the tower, you have just backed, your support thresh is standing there, he doesn't facetank the minions, isntead he leads them to the tower and you miss out on 15 cs. if you communicate with him and say "thresh please facetank the minions so I don't miss out" he should do it, in higher elos it happens automatically because the players aren't %%%%%%ed

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=KBAWy54Q,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-01-05T05:37:08.713+0000)
>
> Without smite available doesn't mean you don't stand a chance when stealing.

Example: Saintvicious

Also in terms for communication, not everyone has the time to type out every single move they plan on making. They are probably more intent on focusing on what to do and how to execute that said plan. If I'm about to attempt to steal a baron and/or Dragon, I'ma be focusing on stealing that objective, when to jump in and how to get out alive, not typing every step I plan on taking to do so in chat. (Voice chat says hey I can help)
Hate teams that start dragon or baron when I don't have smite.
Also valid point, i imagine it would be frustrating for the jungler, did you let your team know you dont have smite?

It depends on how you mean, if this is voice chat, then yes it should be communicated, but do i really want a jungler typing that they don't have smite during this stuff, no not really cause that's more of a waste of time.

why not, all other regions do it.  voice chat and via typing

if you have time to type out the following:

1. abusive comments
2. summs time or ult time on a certain player
3. drag/baron time
4. ask for buffs
5. call for grouping
6. call for split
etc etc etc etc... you get my point, if you have time for those things, you have time to call "no Smite" or "NS"

**its not hard at all.**

calling out early allows the team to prep for the next move

1. Is usually typed during down time by %%%% wits.
2. Is more relevant to multiple people (smite down hardly relates to the entire team, as you can't do anything about it)
3. Is done by the game (i personally do keep a track of the ones i miss where possible though.)
4. Done during down time
5. Done during down time
6. done during down time (i think you get the gist)

Fact is PUTTING IN THAT YOU DON'T HAVE SMITE would normally have to be done during a point where it's not worth typing (would you put in a summoner time while in the middle of a team fight?)

EDIT: As a note, i personally do tell people when i don't have smite, generally by me pinging away from the dragon (IE: danger pings) telling them not to do it, they then proceed to %%%%% that i didn't tell them i didn't have smite, so i honestly believe you would find junglers are telling you a lot more then you think half the time and it's more lack of noticing things.

> would you put in a summoner time while in the middle of a team fight?
>

No I'd make a note of it before or after the the fight and alert the team, and thats the point i'm trying to make here.
use smite for whatever you wish, but let the team know BEFORE they either 

1. Attempt to contest.
2. Attempt to obtain.

we may not need it to secure the objective, but having it available reduces the teams chance of failure.

Communication helps out greatly.



>
> EDIT: As a note, i personally do tell people when i don't have smite, generally by me pinging away from the dragon (IE: danger pings) telling them not to do it, they then proceed to %%%%% that i didn't tell them i didn't have smite, so i honestly believe you would find junglers are telling you a lot more then you think half the time and it's more lack of noticing things.
>

to me i think junglers are the most important role atm, and I'll generally follow their lead, teamwork OP

if they say don't do dragon.. all good.

Your like one in a million to actually listen then, hell when my team decides they will do it anyway i generally head to a lane to try and get their jungler to come at me rather then at dragon.

But fact is, you don't know like 20 seconds in advance that your going to be contesting/obtaining dragon (unless there is no need for smite)

listening is not a hard concept, its part of teamwork which is something i value. 

well riot seem to agree with you on this, they are making changes to smite on the PBE

Smite
Smite now works on a charge (or ammo ) system. You gain one charge every 75 seconds (vs being able to cast it once every 60 seconds) and can hold up to two charges.
Tool tip now includes: "Smite regains a charge every 75 seconds, up to a maximum of 2 charges."
Recharge timer starts at 1:40
There is a 15 sec cooldown between casting Smites.
And now every jungler ever has smite up for Baron/Dragon and multiple smite teams might actually become meta.
Check your lane privilege.

lane privilege?



EDIT: been an hour so I'll assume youll probably not respond but in-case you do, what does my so called lane "privilege" as an ADC have anything to do with communicating to your team?

If I'm omm playing a caster ADC, I'll type or say.. "OOM"

If I'm low, I'll type or say "too low"

if i'm farming, or concerned my team is about to fight and i'm not there / in -range, i'll speak up / type accordingly

Again, i could go on but i trust my point is clear, communication is both easy and required.

Oh I'm sorry, would you also like to know when I need to %%%%?

Smite has a lot of use in the new jungle, with each camp having it's own buff to offer when smited.
Personally I prefer when the team makes an effort so smite isn't desperately needed for dragon or baron.

I rarely use smite on dragon, because you don't need to. Especially if you take the right precautions.
Do you have the enemy jungle warded?
Are any living enemys within range to disrupt taking dragon?
Is your entire team alive, if not how many are up?


Personally I rarely have smite up when my team decides it wants to take dragon, and I rarely have it up when the perfect moment to take it arises.
Do you have Ignite always up so you can ignite that ganking Mundo?

11 times out of 15 I don't smite dragon or baron, it's secured without it.



While communication is a key point of League, I don't feel that it is needed to tell everyone that your summoner spells are down, especially if you're going to do it a lot. Yes you could say "No don't go baron my smite is down" but that would be the only time I find it acceptable to do so.

and thats perfectly reasonable to expect your team mates to burn thier burst spell to finish dragon/baron. 100% agree with you as it increases the chances of secure,   On baron (AKA the throw-zone) smite is a must. there always that chance of steal, baron can easily turn a game on its head, even with precaustions (smite is one of them btw) youd be nuts not to take every possible step to prevent steal. lack of smite should be communicated in this event.


> 
> Personally I rarely have smite up when my team decides it wants to take dragon, and I rarely have it up when the perfect moment to take it arises.

well the question has to be asked, if none of the precautions you mentioned eariler have been actioned.. do you still not let anyone know you have no smite available? because if thats the case, not only is that team laziness on everyone's part including your own, that's just incompetence as a jungler.

most of the time i adc or support, so i use either barrier, heal or exhaust.. but mid laners use ignite, and they roam alot more than adc, supports do too.

also top laners can choose to either take TP or ignite depending on their matchup.. so at the very least. i have a 40% chance of that spell being used on the target

you don't have to say it all the time you kill your wolves, only when

1. your team wants to contest a baron/dragon
2. your team wants to secure a baron/dragon

its not that hard.
Yet the way you are talking here you are saying that we should be putting it in chat everytime we smite wolves or birds, or gromp.

No i'm not.

i don't expect every time smite is used it be announced..
oh crap my team is doing drag i better quickly smite raptors so i can get there quick... fark
I have done all of those at least once by accident.
Shouldnt happen tbh esp in ranked play, the jungle changes have been out for over a month. not a hard concept
Oh have we played a game already? :)

you don't really need smite in every scenario, maybe it is you who is the problem, maybe the jungler isn't %%%%%%ed but you are?
Lee Sin jg goes top lane to gank Ryze, their bot lane has backed, your adc/mid/supp all come to help do dragon, you set up 1-2 wards and if their mid comes your mid stalls them or your jungler just cc's them while adc/supp finish dragon?... simple scenarios such as that u can get dragon without smite
